newsitem.title: GERMANY: German insurance body issues 1995 premium data.
newsitem.headline: German insurance body issues 1995 premium data.

text.p: The German insurance federation, Gesamtverband der Deutschen Versicherungswirtschaft (GDV), has published revised 1995 premium income statistics, based on notifications from individual member companies.

The figures replace earlier tables, based partly on estimates. Premium income German insurance market (excluding government and statutory social insurance) - Gross premiums by insurance class; primary business.

NOTES - 1) gross premiums written by GDV member companies (without premiums resulting from bonus and rebate provisions), 2) including additional charges, but without premiums resulting from rebate provisions, 3) including accident insurance but excluding credit, aviation and nuclear insurance,

4) credit insurance without assessment fees, nuclear insurance primary and reinsurance business, 5) including pension and funeral expenses funds and other non-GDV members, but excluding subsidiaries of insurers from EU countries, 6) including 2.5 billion marks from compulsory private nursing care insurance, introduced 1995, 7) excluding private nursing care: 4.6 percent,

8) excluding private nursing care: 4.8 percent, 9) excluding private nursing care: 4.4 percent, (s) increase partly due to changes in composition of GDV membership. -- Reuters Insurance News 44 171 542 2769
